content:
HttpCachePolicyBase Class

Definition

Serves as the base class for classes that contain methods for setting cache-specific HTTP headers and for controlling the ASP.NET page output cache.

In this Article

public abstract class HttpCachePolicyBase
Inheritance
System.Object
HttpCachePolicyBase

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The HttpCachePolicyBase class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the HttpCachePolicy class. The HttpCachePolicyBase class lets you create derived classes that are like the HttpCachePolicy class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline. When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.

The HttpCachePolicyWrapper class derives from the HttpCachePolicyBase class. The HttpCachePolicyWrapper class serves as a wrapper for the HttpCachePolicy class. At run time, you typically use an instance of the HttpCachePolicyWrapper class to call members of the HttpCachePolicy object.

Constructors

HttpCachePolicyBase()

Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.

protected HttpCachePolicyBase ();

Properties

VaryByContentEncodings

When overridden in a derived class, gets the list of Content-Encoding headers that are used to vary the output cache.

public virtual System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByContentEncodings VaryByContentEncodings { get; }
Value
HttpCacheVaryByContentEncodings

The Content-Encoding headers that are used to select the cached response.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

VaryByHeaders

When overridden in a derived class, gets the list of all HTTP headers that are used to vary cache output.

public virtual System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByHeaders VaryByHeaders { get; }
Value
HttpCacheVaryByHeaders

The HTTP headers that are used to select the cached response.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

VaryByParams

When overridden in a derived class, gets the list of parameters that are received by an HTTP GET or POST verb that affect caching.

public virtual System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByParams VaryByParams { get; }
Value
HttpCacheVaryByParams

The cache-control parameters that are used to select the cached response.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Methods

AddValidationCallback(HttpCacheValidateHandler,Object)

When overridden in a derived class, registers a validation callback for the current response.

public virtual void AddValidationCallback (System.Web.HttpCacheValidateHandler handler, object data);
handler
HttpCacheValidateHandler

The object that will handle the request.

data
System.Object

The user-supplied data that is passed to the stem.Web.HttpCachePolicyWrapper.AddValidationCallback* delegate.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

AppendCacheExtension(String)

When overridden in a derived class, appends the specified text to the Cache-Control HTTP header.

public virtual void AppendCacheExtension (string extension);
extension
String

The text to append to the Cache-Control header.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory(Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, makes the response available in the browser history cache, regardless of the HttpCacheability setting made on the server.

public virtual void SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory (bool allow);
allow
Boolean

true to direct the client browser to store responses in the browser history cache; otherwise false.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetCacheability(HttpCacheability)

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Cache-Control header to the specified HttpCacheability value.

public virtual void SetCacheability (System.Web.HttpCacheability cacheability);
cacheability
HttpCacheability

The HttpCacheability enumeration value to set the header to.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetCacheability(HttpCacheability,String)

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Cache-Control header to the specified HttpCacheability value and appends an extension to the directive.

public virtual void SetCacheability (System.Web.HttpCacheability cacheability, string field);
cacheability
HttpCacheability

The HttpCacheability enumeration value to set the header to.

field
String

The cache-control extension to add to the header.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetETag(String)

When overridden in a derived class, sets the ETag HTTP header to the specified string.

public virtual void SetETag (string etag);
etag
String

The text to use for the ETag header.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetETagFromFileDependencies()

When overridden in a derived class, sets the ETag HTTP header based on the time stamps of the handler's file dependencies.

public virtual void SetETagFromFileDependencies ();
Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetExpires(DateTime)

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Expires HTTP header to an absolute date and time.

public virtual void SetExpires (DateTime date);
date
DateTime

The absolute expiration time.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetLastModified(DateTime)

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Last-Modified HTTP header to the specified date and time.

public virtual void SetLastModified (DateTime date);
date
DateTime

The date-time value to set the Last-Modified header to.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetLastModifiedFromFileDependencies()

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Last-Modified HTTP header based on the time stamps of the handler's file dependencies.

public virtual void SetLastModifiedFromFileDependencies ();
Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetMaxAge(TimeSpan)

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Cache-Control: max-age HTTP header to the specified time span.

public virtual void SetMaxAge (TimeSpan delta);
delta
TimeSpan

The time span to set the Cache-Control: max-age header to.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetNoServerCaching()

When overridden in a derived class, stops all origin-server caching for the current response.

public virtual void SetNoServerCaching ();
Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetNoStore()

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Cache-Control: no-store HTTP header.

public virtual void SetNoStore ();
Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetNoTransforms()

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Cache-Control: no-transform HTTP header.

public virtual void SetNoTransforms ();
Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetOmitVaryStar(Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, specifies whether the response contains the vary:* header when caching varies by parameters.

public virtual void SetOmitVaryStar (bool omit);
omit
Boolean

true to direct the HttpCachePolicy object not to use the * value for its stem.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByHeaders* property; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetProxyMaxAge(TimeSpan)

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Cache-Control: s-maxage HTTP header to the specified time span.

public virtual void SetProxyMaxAge (TimeSpan delta);
delta
TimeSpan

The time span to set the Cache-Control: s-maxage header to.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetRevalidation(HttpCacheRevalidation)

When overridden in a derived class, sets the Cache-Control HTTP header to either the must-revalidate or the proxy-revalidate directives, based on the specified enumeration value.

public virtual void SetRevalidation (System.Web.HttpCacheRevalidation revalidation);
revalidation
HttpCacheRevalidation

The HttpCacheRevalidation enumeration value to set the Cache-Control header to.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetSlidingExpiration(Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, sets cache expiration to absolute or sliding.

public virtual void SetSlidingExpiration (bool slide);
slide
Boolean

true to set a sliding cache expiration, or false to set an absolute cache expiration.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetValidUntilExpires(Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, specifies whether the ASP.NET cache should ignore HTTP Cache-Control headers that are sent by the client that invalidate the cache.

public virtual void SetValidUntilExpires (bool validUntilExpires);
validUntilExpires
Boolean

true to specify that ASP.NET should ignore Cache-Control invalidation headers; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

SetVaryByCustom(String)

When overridden in a derived class, specifies a text string to vary cached output responses by.

public virtual void SetVaryByCustom (string custom);
custom
String

The text string to vary cached output by.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.
